title: Cities I have lived in
name: Cities I have lived in
description:
A Map by Deltayankee

I grew up as a military brat and so lived in several different places.

properties.name: 3rd California Location - Alameda Court
properties.description: Posted by Deltayankee For some reason, I remember the Alameda Court place pretty well. It was a house we rented there. I learned to actually ride a bike without training wheels by riding one with just one training wheel for a while. Underneath the house was what looked like a giant albino toad, but was probably a dog or something. There were a lot of cacti behind the house, some of which a neighbor asked to cut so they could eat them. And my mom was bitten by a German Shepard (I think it\'s name was Booboo or something like that.)

properties.name: First stop in California
properties.description: Posted by Deltayankee255 W 13th St, San Bernardino, CAI don\'t know the exact street we lived at here, but my first California school was Lincoln Elementary. I remember I was in second grade, but I went to a fifth grade class for either reading or math. One day while at home, my mom & dad saw our apartment manager coming in. He was nude. My parents laughed that he had been streaking, but it turned out he had raped somebody.

properties.name: Keesler AFB, MS
properties.description: Posted by DeltayankeeKeesler AFB, MSKeesler is where I went into Tech School. In Biloxi, I found the only other Pyros video game (one of my favorites from Japan). I also lost my "Rocky Horror Picture Show" "virginity" at a local theater.

properties.name: Kent, AL
properties.description: Posted by DeltayankeeKent, ALI was born in Montgomery, but lived in Kent, AL, for the first few years of my life.

properties.name: Lackland AFB, Tx
properties.description: Posted by DeltayankeeLackland AFB, TXHere is where I went through Basic Training. I missed both of our parades, because the inside retainer I had for my braces (the braces were gone, I just had the retainer) came off. I went to the dentist when it came off (for my first parade) and he asked when I\'d like to get the new one. I asked to come back for the second parade time and he agreed. :-)

properties.name: McDill AFB, Florida
properties.description: Posted by Deltayankee   McDill AFB, FLFor Fifth grade, we lived in McDill AFB, Florida. Here, I fell in love with Kristina Roscoe, went swimming in the ocean, "saved" horseshoe crabs from being buried alive (they were actually mating), and the like. My sister and I saw a ghost (a pirate ghost). My teacher (who I had a crush on) was Mrs. Bean, the Tampa Bay Buccaneer\'s cheerleaders. (There were also cheerleaders as teachers as well.) Mrs. Slobotski (I think that was her name), the reading teacher, was pretty much mean and hated by most students.

properties.name: Montgomery, AL
properties.description: Posted by DeltayankeeMontgomery, ALOur first move from Kent was an apartment in Montgomery, AL. I lived in Kent and Montgomery until I started second grade.

properties.name: Norton AFB, California
properties.description: Posted by Deltayankee1472 E 6th St, san bernardino, CA(This probably isn\'t the right location, but I can\'t find it.) I went through 4th grade while living here (IIRC). I remember locking my key in the house (a military family house) and the next-door neighbor let me in by sticking a butterknife in the doorframe. His sister babysat us and, well, she was my first crush. :-) Her name (IIRC) was Beth.

properties.name: Oklahoma City, OK
properties.description: Posted by Deltayankee1900 S Sunnylane Rd, Oklahoma City, OKI went through sixth grade here. Not much to say about it, since I don\'t remember much about it. I wonder why... Anyway, I do remember the tree where we lived had a platform (not even close to a treehouse) and I liked it.

properties.name: Scott AFB, IL
properties.description: Posted by DeltayankeeScott AFB, ILAfter graduation, I stayed a bit at Scott AFB, Illinois. Basically, here is where I joined the military because I didn\'t have anything better to do.

properties.name: Second California Location
properties.description: Posted by Deltayankee Okay, after we moved to an apartment here, I started going to Del Rosa Elementary. My sister went to a kindergarten right behind this place. The first time I rode a bicycle with no training wheels took place on a dirt road on a field near Hollly Vista Blvd. I fell down and gave up on it. Also, I remember that I was worried about an imaginary mechanical bulldog under my bed. :-) We lived here for part of third grade.

properties.name: Tinker AFB, OK
properties.description: Posted by Deltayankee For 7-8 Grade, I lived at Tinker AFB. I went to Jarman Jr. High, right outside of the base. I was in the Humanities (accelerated) class, where we wrote and performed a play for small children. (I was a toy magician - all the characters were toys.) I was in the Boy Scouts. We got cable TV for the first time here! Also, we had a pool pass.

properties.name: Yokota Air Base, Japan
properties.description: Posted by Deltayankeeyokota, japan(Hopefully this marker is at the right place.) After moving from Oklahoma, we went to Yokota AB, Japan. I lived here for four years, from 9th grade through graduation. I was a founder and president of the video club. I fought depression throughout this time. We (my family and I) went on shopping trips to South Korea.
